organic_results.title: Variation in date of enactment of compulsory school attendance laws: An empirical inquiry
organic_results.snippet: This paper presents an explanation for the variation in date of enactment of compulsory school attendance legislation. Enactment of compulsory schooling is interpreted in terms of resources committed by states to sustain public schooling for all. Using data drawn from the 1870 Census on populations and occupations, the paper analyzes specific conditions favorable to the commitment of such resources. The interaction of percent of males in agriculture with the ratio of school-age children to adult males is the strongest predictor of …
